attributes.name: Feature

attributes.description: An experience is a way to address a scenario, fundamental, or a set of papercuts, each of which often have multiple realizing experiences. Often written as a demonstration script, it describes the ideal end-user work flow for realizing one or more of the associated value propositions.

attributes.description: A fundamental describes the basic essentials of a software product, such as quality and performance standards. It is a non-negotiable aspect of a product and its absence reduces the value provided to the user.

attributes.name: Fundamental

attributes.description: A papercut is a minor issue, often too small to be individually prioritized to be addressed; collectively, papercuts degrade the perception of the product. Grouped together, they receive higher priority and can be tackled together within a development cycle.
